variant.question: What phrase should ATC use when transmitting the runway visual range (RVR) for runway 16?

options.text: RVR runway 16 touchdown __meters, mid-point __meters, stop end __meters.
The values of the transmissometer are __ meters and __meters.
RVR at the beginning of runway 16 is __ meters.
RVR runway 16 __ meters diagonal __ meters diagonal __ meters.

variant.question: What phrase should ATC use when transmitting the runway visual range (RVR) for runway 16?

options.text: RVR runway 16 touchdown ... meters, mid-point ... meters, stop end ... meters.
The values of the transmissometer are ... meters and ... meters.
RVR runway 16 ... meters diagonal ... meters diagonal ... meters.
RVR at the beginning of runway 16 is ... meters.

variant.question:
You are approaching an ATS reporting point.
 The controller has instructed you to make routine meteorological reports, the last of which was approximately one hour ago.
 You experience turbulence, which makes occupants feel strain against the seat belts.
 As required by the Standardised European Rules of the Air (SERA), you should:

options.text: make a special air report and omit the routine report.
make the routine report at the reporting point but, since the turbulence is only moderate, it can be excluded from the report.
include the information in the routine report, which should be made in approximately one hour.
include the information in the routine report due at the reporting point.

variant.question: An aircraft that encounters certain meteorological phenomena in flight must make a special report. Which of the following must be reported?

options.text: A heavy sandstorm seen some distance from track.
Light turbulence experienced by the aircraft.
Light icing experienced by the aircraft.
An isolated thunderstorm seen close to track.
